did.unittitle: Peter Lewis Allen Collection of Safe Sex Pamphlets
did.abstract: The Peter Lewis Allen Collection of Safe Sex Pamphlets contains pamphlets, brochures, postcards, and objects relating to sexual health issues from 1974-2007. These materials were produced and distributed in the United States, Latin America, and Europe. In addition to print materials the collection houses several condoms and safe sex kits, and a t-shirt.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The materials in the collection were amassed by Peter Lewis Allen, Ph.D. The collection was donated by Peter Allen in 2007.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers without restrictions. Appointments are necessary to consult archive and manuscript materials.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Peter Lewis Allen, Ph.D. is a scholar and author whose interests include culture, history, and sexuality. Among his publications is The Wages of Sin: Sex and Disease, Past and Present(Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 2000).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection is organized into two series containing the materials collected by Peter Lewis Allen. The materials in Series I include brochures, pamphlets, postcards, and magazines from the 1980s and 1990s. Series II contains condoms and safe sex kits as well as a t-shirt. The materials focus on HIV/AIDS prevention but also include subjects such as safe sex and STD prevention, pregnancy, abstinence, drug use, teenagers and sex, menopause, and birth control. These materials were in the main published and distributed by health clinics and organizations such as Gay Men's Health Crisis and Planned Parenthood. The collection also includes several international pamphlets from Europe and Latin America. Languages include English, Spanish, French, and Dutch.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into two series. Series I: Pamphlets and Brochurescontains the bulk of the collection. Series II: Physical Objectscontains condoms, safe sex kits and a t-shirt.
